publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-5622 Ross Finnie: Withdrawal of Renfrew to Yoker Ferry—That the Parliament notes the decision by Strathclyde Partnership for Transport (SPT) to remove, from March 2010, the Renfrew to Yoker ferry service, one of Scotland’s oldest ferry links, used by 140,000 passengers a year, and calls on the SPT to re-evaluate the options with a view to retaining this essential service.
S3M-5622 Withdrawal of Renfrew to Yoker Ferry (lodged on 27 January 2010) Jim Hume*, Hugh O’Donnell*, Rob Gibson*, Gil Paterson*, Ms Wendy Alexander*, Robin Harper*, Patrick Harvie*

S3M-5622 Ross Finnie: Withdrawal of Renfrew to Yoker Ferry—That the Parliament notes the decision by Strathclyde Partnership for Transport (SPT) to remove, from March 2010, the Renfrew to Yoker ferry service, one of Scotland’s oldest ferry links, used by 140,000 passengers a year, and calls on the SPT to re-evaluate the options with a view to retaining this essential service. Supported by: Jim Hume, Hugh O’Donnell, Rob Gibson, Gil Paterson, Ms Wendy Alexander, Robin Harper, Patrick Harvie, Robert Brown*, Sandra White*
